Issues.Title: docs-infra: update deploy-to-firebase.sh script to support v9 multisi‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶te setup

v9.angular.io was used to pilot the firebase hosting multisites setup for angular.io.

The deployments so far have been done manually to control the deployment process.

This change, automates the deployment for v9.angular.io so that future deployments can be made from
the CI.

See https://angular-team.atlassian.net/browse/DEV-125 for more info.

In the process of updating the scripts I rediscovered a bug in the deploy-to-firebase.sh script that incorrect compared two numbers as strings. This previously worked correctly because we were comparing single digit numbers. With the release of v10, we now compare 9 > 10 which behaves differently for strings and numbers. The bug was fixed by switching to an arithmetic comparison of the two variables.
    
This bug has been fixed on the master branch but not on the 9.1.x branch. I realized this during the rebase, but found my version to be a bit cleaner, so I kept it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs-infra: update deploy-to-firebase.sh script to support v9 multisi‚Ä¶" (#37721)

Issues.Title: fix(dev-infra): merge script should not always require full repo permissions
Issues.Body:
We recently added OAuth scope checking to the dev-infra Git client
and started leveraging it for the merge script. We set the `repo` scope
as required for running the merge script. We can loosen this requirement
as in the Angular org where the script is consumed, only pull requests on
public repositories are merged through the script.

This should help with reducing the risk with compromised tokens as no
access had to be granted on `repo:invite`, `repo_deployment` etc.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(dev-infra): merge script should not always require full repo permissions" (#37718)

Issues.Title: fix(router): fix navigation ignoring logic to compare to the browser url
Issues.Body:
This PR changes the logic for determining when to skip route processing from
using the URL of the last attempted navigation to the actual resulting URL after
that transition.

Because guards may prevent navigation and reset the browser URL, the raw
URL of the previous transition may not match the actual URL of the
browser at the end of the navigation process. For that reason, we need to use
`urlAfterRedirects` if the previous navigation failed.

Note that this is a resubmit of https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/d3a817549b82c3f8c866296af4e952d1af5ac087 which caused a failure in Google. I've verified that this change does not result in the same failure but this PR should still be merged and synced separately.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(router): fix navigation ignoring logic to compare to the browser url" (#37716)

Issues.Title: perf(core): add ability to provide a test setup function to benchmarks
Issues.Body:
This commit adds the ability to provide a test setup function to a micro benchmark. With this,
benchmarks can now handle expensive setup operations that may mutate state which needs
to be reset on each iteration. These setups will not be included in profile timings.

I modified this a little from what I had done in #37710 so that the time to run the test setup is tracked separately. If you think modifying the timestamp directly is more understandable (see changes in #37710), I can change it back.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(core): add ability to provide a test setup function to benchmarks" (#37713)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): shorten _nghost and _ngcontent prefixes to _h and _c
Issues.Body:
Shortening _nghost and _ngcontent will significantly reduce the overhead from adding additional attributes to HTML elements.

This allows for smaller bundles, which can improve download speeds and reduce parsing time.

This has been tested by running spec tests in compiler, platform-browser, and platform server. In addition, the changes were tested by building aio using the locally built version of angular.

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): Update %COMP% string to %C% and updated regex to not search globally.
Issues.Body:
Changed the %COMP% component placeholder in the temporary attribute to %C% to shorten the attribute.

Changed COMPONENT_REGEX in dom_renderer.ts to not search the string globally, since %C% will only appear once in an attribute selector.

Shortening the attribute allows a smaller bundle size and a smaller download before the platform-server shis the component attribute with component ID.

All spec tests involving %COMP% have been updated to use %C%.

Issues.Title: feat(ngcc): support passing a list of entry-points to process
Issues.Body:
Similar to the targeted entry-point mode, where we can pass in a
single entry-point path as the starting point for processing, this
commit adds support for passing in a list of such target entry-points.
This is achieved by pointing ngcc at a JSON file that holds the list
of paths to the entry-points. These entry-points, and their dependencies,
will then be processed by ngcc.

The path to the file containing the entry-point paths is configured
programmatically by setting the `entryPointListPath` property or via
the command line by the `--entry-points-file` option.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(ngcc): support passing a list of entry-points to process" (#37707)

Issues.Title: Marking @Input as required, again
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
There is a long history of discussion about whether / how to have the compiler enforce that specific inputs are provided to components: #11904 #18156 #24879 #28403 #30974  

However, all of those are now closed and locked.  They contain some advice about how to mitigate the problem, or kick the can down the road ("One day I hope we'll be able to do this. That day is not today."), but thanks to the lock-bot none of them can be used to continue the conversation, so I guess we need yet another issue, because I believe the problem still exists.


### Describe the solution you'd like
It should be possible to annotate inputs such that using a component in a template without providing a value for that input is a compile-time error.  Template checking has come a long way, and it's already possible for the compiler to flag providing the wrong type as an argument.  Combine with the `strictPropertyInitializers` flag, and such a check could rely on the existing `!` assertion operator.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
The best approach I've seen while reviewing the above issues is specifying the required attributes in the `selector` component metadata, but a) apparently that won't catch passing `null` or `undefined` to an Input that not defined with a type that includes those values, and b) that appears to break certain test harnesses?  Also, I haven't started using `strictTemplates` / `fullTemplateTypeCheck` yet due to some problems in previous versions with narrowing on `*ngIf` that may or may not have been resolved -- those existing capabilities may address some or all of this need.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Marking @Input as required, again" (#37706)

Issues.Title: ngcc --async takes too long every time
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler

### Is this a regression?

Not sure

### Description

On my CI, the installation of packages takes a very long time, more precisely postinstall with `ngcc --async`

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

```
$ git clone https://github.com/Angular-RU/angular-ru-sdk.git
$ cd angular-ru-sdk
$ yarn install
```

First yarn install:

```
...
Compiling @angular/router/testing : esm2015 as esm2015
Compiling @angular/router/testing : esm5 as esm5
Compiling @angular/router/testing : main as umd
Compiling ngx-toastr : fesm5 as esm5
Compiling ngx-toastr : esm2015 as esm2015
Compiling ngx-toastr : esm5 as esm5
Compiling ngx-toastr : main as umd
‚ú®  Done in 110.03s.
```

```
$ rm yarn.lock
$ yarn install
```

Second yarn install:

```
...
Compiling @angular/router/testing : esm2015 as esm2015
Compiling @angular/router/testing : esm5 as esm5
Compiling @angular/router/testing : main as umd
Compiling ngx-toastr : fesm5 as esm5
Compiling ngx-toastr : esm2015 as esm2015
Compiling ngx-toastr : esm5 as esm5
Compiling ngx-toastr : main as umd
‚ú®  Done in 130.03s.
```

```
$ rm yarn.lock
$ yarn install
```

`N+` yarn install:

```
...
Compiling @angular/router/testing : esm2015 as esm2015
Compiling @angular/router/testing : esm5 as esm5
Compiling @angular/router/testing : main as umd
Compiling ngx-toastr : fesm5 as esm5
Compiling ngx-toastr : esm2015 as esm2015
Compiling ngx-toastr : esm5 as esm5
Compiling ngx-toastr : main as umd
‚ú®  Done in 1250.03s.
```

In my last `ngcc` 1250.03s. - why?

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**

Angular 9.1.11
LernaJS monorepo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ngcc --async takes too long every time" (#37702)

Issues.Title: ci(docs-infra): store JS bundles as CI artifacts to debug size check flakes
Issues.Body:
As reported in #37699, the size of the main angular.io bundle sometimes ends up bigger than expected on CI. This usually goes away after rerunning the job a couple of times.

It is unclear what is causing this. In order to help debug the issue, this commit stores the JS files that are checked as part of the aio payload-size check as CI artifacts, where they can be retrieved from and inspected.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci(docs-infra): store JS bundles as CI artifacts to debug size check flakes" (#37703)

Create initial document for Angular framework coding standards. This
document will evolve over time. This version contains all

and examples were copied from angular/components.

Issues.Title: Flaky `test_aio` CircleCI job due to size check
Issues.Body:
The `test_aio` CircleCI job sometimes fails false-positively with the payload size error (over 20kb diff):
```
FAIL: Commit c95802f26f80de933f8cf62898115bbe938fff94 uncompressed main-es2015 exceeded expected size by 500 bytes or >1% (expected: 453213, actual: 476811).
 ```
Example of the most recent failure in master [can be found here](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/angular/angular/17542/workflows/f2ff23d5-7841-4a09-8f7b-e7c9e0c72e28/jobs/747016/steps). In that particular case, it was a [docs-only commit](https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/c95802f26f80de933f8cf62898115bbe938fff94).

Restarting the CircleCI job usually fixes the problem.

cc @gkalpak
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Flaky `test_aio` CircleCI job due to size check" (#37699)

Issues.Title: Forms: refactor min/max and minLength/maxLength validators to share the code
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Forms: refactor min/max and minLength/maxLength validators to share the code" (#37698)

Issues.Title: Forms: consider using `ngDevMode` to tree-shake error messages text in prod mode
Issues.Body: In Ivy runtime code, the `ngDevMode` const is used to guard asserts required in dev mode only. We should consider doing the same in Forms package to tree-shake error messages text (which cannot be minified) and some dev mode specific checks. That should help reduce the size of the `forms` package in production mode.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Forms: consider using `ngDevMode` to tree-shake error messages text in prod mode" (#37697)

Issues.Title: Clarify and improve lightweight-injection-tokens.md guide
Issues.Body:
This issue was created to keep track of follow up AIs from https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/36144#pullrequestreview-436209714

I'd like us to follow up on the initial version of the doc after v10 is out and address several key points:

- [ ] the intro into the guide could be more focused "This guide documents a recommended pattern for Angular library authors that ensure that their libraries are optimizable. Angular libraries are often composed of core functionality, as well as optional features. This lightweight injection pattern ensure that the code associated with the optional features unused by a particular application, is optimized away during production builds of this application."
- [ ] some of the headings could be made more clear, I'll defer to @aikidave's guidance on this
- [ ] somewhere early on, we should state that the pattern is applicable to two use-cases: optional features expressed as directives or components that the core part of the librarie queries for via @ContentChild, @ViewChild, etc. and optional dependencies injected into the constructor of a service or a component and flagged with the @Optional() decorator - this guide seems to mix these two use-cases, which results in confusion when the reader reads it. Again - the pattern and the recommendation to use abstract classes are applicable to both scenarios, but we should document them as two distinct use-case and show them off on two different examples.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clarify and improve lightweight-injection-tokens.md guide" (#37696)

-   **router:** Fix relative link generation from empty path components ([#​37446](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37446)) ([585e3f6](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/585e3f6)), closes [#​26243](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/26243) [#​13011](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/13011) [#​35687](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/35687)

-   **router:** cancel navigation when at least one resolver completes with no "next" emission ([#​24621](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/24621)) ([d9c4840](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/d9c4840)), closes [#​24195](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/24195)
-   **router:** fix navigation ignoring logic to compare to the browser url ([#​37408](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37408)) ([5db2e79](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/5db2e79)), closes [#​16710](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/16710) [#​13586](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/13586)

-   **service-worker:** prevent SW registration strategies from affecting app stabilization ([#​35870](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/35870)) ([2d7c95f](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/2d7c95f))

-   add aikidave as reviewer for DOCS: Marketing ([#​37014](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37014)) ([286fbf4](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/286fbf4))

##### Code Refactoring

-   **common:** remove WrappedValue from AsyncPipe ([#​36633](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36633)) ([49be32c](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/49be32c)), closes [#​29927](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/29927)

##### Performance Improvements

-   **compiler-cli:** perform template type-checking incrementally ([#​36211](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36211)) ([ecffc35](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/ecffc35))
-   **compiler-cli:** split Ivy template type-checking into multiple files ([#​36211](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36211)) ([b861e9c](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/b861e9c))
-   **core:** avoid pulling in jit-specific code in aot bundles ([#​37372](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37372)) ([#​37514](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37514)) ([6114cd2](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/6114cd2)), closes [#​29083](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/29083)
-   **forms:** optimize internal method \_anyControls in FormGroup ([#​32534](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/32534)) ([6c7467a](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/6c7467a))
-   **ngcc:** allow immediately reporting a stale lock file ([#​37250](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37250)) ([930d204](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/930d204))
-   **ngcc:** cache parsed tsconfig between runs ([#​37417](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37417)) ([f9daa13](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/f9daa13)), closes [#​36882](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36882)
-   **ngcc:** only compute basePaths in TargetedEntryPointFinder when needed ([#​36881](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36881)) ([ec6b9cc](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/ec6b9cc)), closes [#​36874](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36874)
-   **ngcc:** only load  if it is needed ([#​36486](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36486)) ([3bedfda](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/3bedfda))
-   **ngcc:** read dependencies from entry-point manifest ([#​36486](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36486)) ([a185efb](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/a185efb)), closes [#issuecomment-608401834](https://togithub.com/angular/angular#issuecomment-608401834)
-   **ngcc:** reduce the size of the entry-point manifest file ([#​36486](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36486)) ([ec0ce60](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/ec0ce60))
-   **ngcc:** speed up the `getBasePaths()` computation ([#​36881](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/36881)) ([e037840](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/e037840))

##### Dependency updates

[@​angular/compiler-cli](https://togithub.com/angular/compiler-cli) now requires:

-   TypeScript 3.9

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   TypeScript 3.6, 3.7 and 3.8 are no longer supported, please update to TypeScript 3.9.
-   **core:** Angular npm packages no longer contain jsdoc comments
    to support Closure Compiler's advanced optimizations

The support for Closure Compiler in Angular packages has been
experimental and broken for quite some time.

As of TS3.9, Closure is unusable with the JavaScript emit. Please follow
[microsoft/TypeScript#​38374](https://togithub.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/38374) for more
information and updates.

If you used Closure Compiler with Angular in the past, you will likely
be better off consuming Angular packages built from sources directly 
rather than consuming the version we publish on npm,
which is primarily optimized for Webpack/Rollup + Terser build pipeline.

As a temporary workaround, you might consider using your current build
pipeline with Closure flag `--compilation_level=SIMPLE`. This flag 
will ensure that your build pipeline produces buildable and
runnable artifacts, at the cost of increased payload size due to
advanced optimizations being disabled.

If you were affected by this change, please help us understand your
needs by leaving a comment on [#​37234](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/37234).

-   **core:** make generic mandatory for ModuleWithProviders 

A generic type parameter has always been required for the `ModuleWithProviders` pattern to work with Ivy, but prior to this commit, View Engine allowed the generic type to be omitted (though support was officially deprecated).
If you're using `ModuleWithProviders` without a generic type in your application code, a v10 migration will update your code for you. 

However, if you are using View Engine and also depending on a library that omits the generic type, you will now get a build time error similar to:

    error TS2314: Generic type 'ModuleWithProviders<T>' requires 1 type argument(s).

In this case, ngcc won't help you (because it's Ivy-only) and the migration only covers application code.
You should contact the library author to fix their library to provide a type parameter when they use this class.

As a workaround, we suggest setting `skipLibChecks` to false in your tsconfig or updating your app to use Ivy.

-   **forms:** Number inputs no longer listen to the `change` event.

Tests which trigger `change` events need to be updated to trigger `input` events instead.

The `change` event was in place to support IE9, as we found that `input` events were not fired with backspace or cut actions. If you need to maintain IE9 support, you will need to add a change event listener to number inputs and call the `onChange` method of `NumberValueAccessor` manually.

Lastly, old versions of WebDriver would synthetically trigger the `change` event on `WebElement.clear` and `WebElement.sendKeys`. If you are using an old version of WebDriver, you may need to update tests to ensure `input` events are triggered. For example, you could use `element.sendKeys(Keys.chord(Keys.CONTROL, "a"), Keys.BACK_SPACE);` in place of `element.clear()`.

-   **forms:** The `minLength` and `maxLength` validators now verify that the form control's value has a
    numeric `length` property, and only validate for length if that's the case.

Previously, falsey values without the length property (such as `0` or
`false` values) were triggering validation errors. If your code relies on
the old behavior, you can include other validators such as [min][1] or
[requiredTrue][2] to the list of validators for a particular field.

[1]: https://angular.io/api/forms/Validators#min

[2]: https://angular.io/api/forms/Validators#requiredTrue

-   **bazel:** esm5 and fesm5 format is no longer distributed in
    Angular's npm packages e.g. [@​angular/core](https://togithub.com/angular/core)

If you are not using Angular CLI to build your application or library,
and you need to be able to build es5 artifacts, then you will need to
downlevel the distributed Angular code to es5 on your own.

Angular CLI will automatically downlevel the code to es5 if differential
loading is enabled in the Angular project, so no action is required from
Angular CLI users.

-   **core:** Warnings about unknown elements are now logged as errors. This won't break your app, but it may trip up tools that expect nothing to be logged via `console.error`.
-   **router:** Any resolver which return EMPTY will cancel navigation.
    If you want to allow the navigation to continue, you will need to update the resolvers to emit
    some value, (i.e. defaultIfEmpty(...), of(...), etc).
-   **service-worker:** Previously, [Vary](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Vary)
    headers would be taken into account when retrieving resources from the
    cache, completely preventing the retrieval of cached assets (due to
    ServiceWorker implementation details) and leading to unpredictable
    behavior due to inconsistent/buggy implementations in different
    browsers.

Now, `Vary` headers are ignored when retrieving resources from the
ServiceWorker caches, which can result in resources being retrieved even
when their headers are different. If your application needs to
differentiate its responses based on request headers, please make sure
the Angular ServiceWorker is [configured](https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-config)
to avoid caching the affected resources.

-   **common:** This change could result in ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenChecked errors that
    were not detected before. The error could previously have gone undetected
    because two WrappedValues are considered "equal" in all cases for the purposes
    of the check, even if their respective unwrapped values are not.

Additionally, `[val]=(observable | async).someProperty` will no longer
trigger change detection if the value of `someProperty` is identical to
the value in the previous emit. If you need to force change detection,
either update the binding to use an object whose reference changes or
subscribe to the observable and call markForCheck as needed.

-   **common:** format day-periods that cross midnight

      When formatting a time with the `b` or `B` format codes, the rendered
      string was not correctly handling day periods that spanned midnight.
      Instead the logic was falling back to the default case of `AM`.

      Now the logic has been updated so that it matches times that are within
      a day period that spans midnight, so it will now render the correct
      output, such as `at night` in the case of English.

      Applications that are using either `formatDate()` or `DatePipe` and any
      of the `b` or `B` format codes will be affected by this change.

-   **router:** UrlMatcher's type now reflects that it could always return
      null.

      If you implemented your own Router or Recognizer class, please update it to
      handle matcher returning null.

Issues.Title: Angular 10: not able to use an image from assets in url() in scss files
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9 ### Description There is no way to use an image from the assets folder with Angular 10. It works fine with v.9. Using the path as absolute `/assets/logo.png` resolves the issue, but it would not work with the base-href option. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Clone it and try to run `ng serve` command. https://github.com/destus90/angular10-postcss-issue ## üî• Exception or Error 



ERROR in ./src/app/app.component.scss
Module Error (from ./node_modules/postcss-loader/src/index.js):
Can't resolve './assets/logo.png'

Issues.Title: [patch] ci: fix dedupe-duplicate-modules flakes
Issues.Body:
Following #17973, which we emitted the stderr when this test failed on CI.

We see that the resolved module order sometimes changes, which is totally fine because of the async nature of the operation.

https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular-cli/167318#tests/containers/5
```
[DedupeModuleResolvePlugin]: /tmp/angular-cli-e2e-i03vMQ/test-project/node_modules/tslib-1 -> /tmp/angular-cli-e2e-i03vMQ/test-project/node_modules/tslib-1-copy
```

With this change we handle both cases which should eliminate the flakes

(cherry picked from commit bf599e4fac433c0b7041b5fac72d10a1677070cc)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[patch] ci: fix dedupe-duplicate-modules flakes" (#18007)

Issues.Title: [feat] run budgets check for dev configuration
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for angular's build package


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->
I think many developers will benefit if Angular checked for issues with the bundle size **during** the development. The *budgets* feature is great, but it only reports issues during "prod" build(*). There could be a lot of changes in the application by the time developer tries to run a prod build and it might be hard to identify the issue resulted in a bundle increase. On the other hand, if bundle size checks were performed during regular *ng serve* workflow, the silly mistakes resulting in increased bundles could be caught right away.

(*) It appears that the "budgets" feature works in any configuration as long as `"optimization": true` is set.

### Describe the solution you'd like
*Run budgets check even when the `optimization` flag is set to false.*
It's OK if the values in the budgets are set to some high numbers due to the nature of un-optimized bundles. The point here is to catch a drastic bundle *increase*.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I've tried adding `dev` configuration to *angular.json*, which would look like this:
```ts
"dev": {
  "optimization": true,
  "vendorChunk": false,
  "budgets": [
    {
      "type": "bundle",
      "name": "main",
      "baseline": "390kb",
      "maximumWarning": "20kb",
      "maximumError": "40kb"
    }
  ]
},
```
This works, but the build process takes too long due to the `optimization` flag.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[feat] run budgets check for dev configuration" (#18011)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use copy-on-write asset processing for non-watch builds
Issues.Body: Optimized asset processing was only being performed when differential loading was enabled.  This change ensures that the optimized approach is used for all builds.  This does not affect `ng serve` usage since it currently requires all application files to be in memory.

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report - [ ] new - [ ] build - [X] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Y - Was fixed as part of https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/2989 Currently running Angular CLI 6.1.5 for an Angular 6 project and experiencing the same issues ### Description When running ng serve if an image file doesn't exist eg http://localhost:4200/assets/img/filedoesnotexist.jpg instead of returning a 404 response the @angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server returns a 200 response and redirects to the '' route I think I need to use a custom builder or if there's another fix I'd love to know but at present it is like the webpack dev server doesn't serve anything in the assets as a static file so it runs through routing The fix appears to force accept HTML headers option to webpack dev server. https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/2989 I have the exact issue where if I request a missing image instead of 404ing it returns 200 and tries to redirect to index.html I was wondering how to use this in my angular.json I'm using angular 6 and CLI version 6.1.5 Or if someone knows of a fix I'd love someone to run up a quick sample project with a few routes and some images and have some assets return 404 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction To test open the ng-test.zip file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5f9putxrny4kfrk/ng-test.zip?dl=0 1. Run npm i 2. Run ng serve 3. Navigate to http://localhost:4200/assets/icons/trafficlight.png 4. You'll see the image served 5. Navigate to http://localhost:4200/assets/icons/nonexistentfile.png 6. Instead of a 404 you get routed to the home screen ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI 6.1.5

Can also reproduce in Angular CLI: 9.1.9 and subsequent latest packages
**Anything else relevant?** Running "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server", in angular.json I don't know if the intention of the team is to have people run a custom dev-server instead? I couldn't find anything in the 200 headers returned for a missing asset file to indicate an error or anything it just looks like a normal 200 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1916426/85363814-2d075100-b565-11ea-9dfd-9a8565878281.png) Here's an example of the fact the dev server a non-existent jpg file as html and returns a 200
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng serve returns 200 for non-existent files in the assets folder instead of 404 - user gets redirected to the default route" (#17989)

Issues.Title: Production Build Breaks Code
Issues.Body:
I can't be very helpful with this bug report other than to say that it works fine when running the AOT build, and breaks when compiling with `--prod`.  

I have multiple modules that are package with the Angular Package Format and the module that breaks with the production build is a pretty advanced forecasting package with AI etc. so nailing down exactly what breaks is hard.

More notes here:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/62546996/debugging-uncaught-typeerror-cannot-read-property-iteration-of-undefined

If I get a better grip on it in the future I'll post back.  Once I get the app deployed without optimization, I could probably deploy another in parallel just to show whats happening.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Production Build Breaks Code" (#17999)

Issues.Title: Multiple assets emit different content to the same filename 0.worker.js.map
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/.... @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... I'm getting this warning during AOT: client:135 Conflict: Multiple assets emit different content to the same filename 0.worker.js.map The App works fine, and I'm 99.99% sure that I don't have different assets emitting to the same worker .... all though perhaps Angular is compiling / optimizing different worker names into the same name ... ? Just something to be aware of. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/... ## üî• Exception or Error 




I'm getting this warning during AOT:

client:135 Conflict: Multiple assets emit different content to the same filename 0.worker.js.map

The App works fine, and I'm 99.99% sure that I don't have different assets emitting to the same worker .... all though perhaps Angular is compiling / optimizing different worker names into the same name ... ?

Just something to be aware of.
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 9.1.7
Node: 12.6.0
OS: linux x64

Angular: 9.1.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: Allow locale specific scripts to be added under i18n so that ng build --localize can copy them over
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request
I should be able to add locale specific scripts or assets.
### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [x] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
Currently, if you add a configuration like below and do `ng build --configuration=fr,production` then the specified scripts in the configuration are getting added to the output scripts.js. but doing ng build --prod --localize doesn't add them.

```
       "es": {
              "localize": [
                "es"
              ],
              "aot": true,
              "outputPath": "dist/dev/",
              "scripts": [
                "src/kendo/lib/kendo.messages.es-PR.js"
              ]
            },
            "fr": {
              "localize": [
                "fr"
              ],
              "aot": true,
              "outputPath": "dist/dev/",
              "scripts": [
                "src/kendo/lib/kendo.messages.fr-CA.js"
              ]
            }
```

 It would be beneficial of such a feature exists so that I can add scripts or assets that for specific to a locale. 


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> 
Along with baseHref, can you please allow scripts and assets to be specified in i18n locales section so that ng build --localize and pick them up and do necessary actions?
```
      "i18n": {
        "locales": {
          "en": {
            "translation": "src/locale/messages.en.xlf",
            "baseHref": "/fvorder/en/",
          },
          "es": {
            "translation": "src/locale/messages.es.xlf",
            "baseHref": "/fvorder/es/",
            "script": ["src/kendo/lib/kendo.messages.es-PR.js"]

          },
          "fr": {
            "translation": "src/locale/messages.fr.xlf",
            "baseHref": "/fvorder/fr/",
            "script": ["src/kendo/lib/kendo.messages.fr-CA.js"]
          }
        }
      }
```


### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Work around: Created a script that copies these scripts to respective output language folders and rename it to some common name. Add script tag to src/index.html that references this script.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow locale specific scripts to be added under i18n so that ng build --localize can copy them over" (#17995)

Issues.Title: Error when running schematics unit test
Issues.Body:
This is my first time working in the world of schematics, so it's quite possible I just don't have this set up correctly. But I've been following the guide on angular.io and some additional blog walkthroughs. I'm wanting to package ng-add and ng-update schematics into a component library, that I already have setup and running well. After setting up the initial plumbing for the ng-add one, I wrote a simple unit test just to validate the setup and as soon as it hits the call to new SchematicTestRunner, it blows up with a ton of Module not found errors, including child_process and fs. In fact i commented out everything in the unit test except the creation of the test runner, just to identify the breaking point. And the schematic itself isn't doing anything yet except returning the tree as-is. Interestingly, the "blank" schematics project doesn't use ng test at all, but instead uses jasmine directly. But with this being in an existing Angular Library with full test suite, i wanted to test in the same way. Any help with this, would be much appreciated! # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Not sure. First time doing this. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: `ng add` installs old package versions in 10.0.0-rc.5
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [x] add ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was v9.1.9 ### Description `ng add` installs old versions instead of `latest`. Managed to reproduce it with both `@kendo-angular-buttons` (installs v0.10.1) and `@angular/material` (installs v7.3.7). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. `npm install -g @angular/cli@next` 1. `ng new ng10-project --defaults --skip-git` 1. `cd ng10-project` 1. `ng add @progress/kendo-angular-buttons` The problem **does not occur** if we specify a version to be installed, e.g. `ng add @progress/kendo-angular-buttons@latest` ## üî• Exception or Error 

The package that you are trying to add does not support schematics. You can try using a different version of the package or contact the package author to add ng-add support.

**Note:** I'm setting it to P2, because it's something that we should've supported from the beginning and it comes up in issues once in a while.

Fixes #19267.

Issues.Title: Autocomplete ADA: mat-option announcement lags behind by one entry
Issues.Body:
**Summary:**
Autocomplete options screen reader announcement lags behind by one entry.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Turn on VoiceOver on Safari on Mac.
2. Access a page with the autocomplete field, e.g.: https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/examples
3. Use the keyboard to access the field, and press up/down arrows to cycle through the items.

**Expected behavior:**
* Items are announced as they are visited

**Actual behavior:**
* Seems like it always announces the previously visited (highlighted) item.

**Impact:**
This is a showstoppper bug for ADA compliance, as a blind user will not be aware that they've picked the wrong item.

**Browsers:**
* Observed that Chrome on VoiceOver also has the issue
* Observed that Firefox on VoiceOver does NOT have the issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Autocomplete ADA: mat-option announcement lags behind by one entry" (#19745)

Issues.Title: build: avoid conflicts when publishing snapshot builds
Issues.Body:
For the past year, we've had CI failures when multiple PRs
have been merged. Since we run CI for all landed commits, the
snapshot publish job runs multiple times concurrently and could
end up pushing to the snapshot repositories out of order.

This can result in conflicts when multiple jobs push artifacts
at the same time. e.g. https://circleci.com/gh/angular/components/155407.

We intend to fix this by queuing snapshot publishing across CircleCI
builds. This is done using the CircleCI API. We constantly check the
API to check that there are no previous snapshot jobs running.

Instead of implementing this logic our own, we leverage a CircleCI
orb that provides this functionality.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: avoid conflicts when publishing snapshot builds" (#19737)

Issues.Title: feat(google-maps): allow map to be styled natively instead of through inputs
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
Currently, the google-map object takes a height and width input which are then coerced to px values. This appears to break whenever a value is provided that isn't a css length unit.

#### Use Case
I'd like to set the height of the google to be `calc(100vh - var(--header-height))`. Unfortunately, because the api is designed to use these inputs as _inline styles_ I'm forced to use `!important` to override the default `500px` values. For example, if I use css in the global scope:

``` css
.map-container {
  height: calc(100vh - var(--header-height));
  width: 100%;
}
```
what you end up with is:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9759954/85430773-92037c80-b54e-11ea-9b99-f91729d4e273.png)
and
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9759954/85430806-9def3e80-b54e-11ea-8f65-683e875ea37f.png)

### Solution

Remove the inputs and allow folks to style the map natively using css.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(google-maps): allow map to be styled natively instead of through inputs" (#19732)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): not marking as dirty when invalid value is typed in
Issues.Body:
Currently we only mark the datepicker's `ControlValueAccessor` as dirty if the value changed as a result of the user typing something in. The problem is that typing in an invalid value is parsed to `null` which is the same as the default value, causing it not to be marked as dirty. One small complication here that I've added a test for is that we shouldn't be dispatching change events when typing in invalid values.

Fixes #19726.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(datepicker): not marking as dirty when invalid value is typed in" (#19730)

Issues.Title: feat(tab): Add [showOverflow] input
Issues.Body:
### Motivation

Tabs hide their tab body overflow so that the tab body "slide-in" / "slide-out" animation effect works properly. This can lead to non-obvious visual bugs where drop shadows, ripples, and focus indicators are inadvertently clipped from view. The official guidance is to simply apply inner padding to the tab body, but this can mess with page flow and visual hierarchy if some content is insetted and other content isn't.

### Proposal

If the animation effect is disabled with `[animationDuration]="0"`, tabs no longer need to hide their overflow. Consequently, we should be able to reset the now unnecessary `overflow` styles to `overflow: visible` and instead toggle tab views with `display`.

This PR introduces a new input `[showOverflow]` that does exactly that. Note that if `[animationDuration]` is non-zero, `[showOverflow]` must be `false`.

To reiterate, we'd prefer to simply just *always* remove the `overflow` styles, but they are a hard dependency of the slide animation. AFAICT, there's no way to show overflow while also hiding overflow as tab content slides in-and-out.

If the input and implementation are reasonable, I'm happy to add a few unit tests that validate some styles are set correctly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(tab): Add [showOverflow] input" (#19729)

#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
If I enter an invalid date like 'aaa' in Datepicker for the first time, then the dirty flag is not set. And then the ShowOnDirtyErrorStateMatcher does not show an error.

With the OnBlur Matcher it is working. Please comment out line 26 in app.component.ts and try it again. Enter 'aaa' and trigger onBlur while you click the tab key.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior
The date control is marked as dirty and the error is shown.


#### Actual Behavior

No error is displayed because the control is not marked as dirty.


#### Environment

- CDK/Material: 9.2.4
